intro: Habranthus tepicensis, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and extreme temperatures. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is often cultivated in xeriscapic gardens.
